DOC.brief_summary: This project randomize control trial compare efficacy two interventions- one base Acceptance Commitment Therapy ( ACT ) one base Self-Regulation ( SR ) - control group ( call weight loss ( WLO ) ) 24-month weight loss outcome . All participant first participate initial 4-month standard behavioral weight loss program . Participants randomize 1 3 group receive 3-part workshop ; ACT workshop teach ACT skills include acceptance mindfulness technique design promote behavior change health behavior persistence consistent one 's core value . The SR program focus self-regulation , regular weighing , model behavior successful maintainer . The WLO group receive control workshop focus cook demonstration general nutrition topics.The primary outcome weight loss 24 month . The secondary outcome change psychological flexibility , critical component ACT interventions potential innovative mediating mechanism . Primary Hypothesis : At 24 month , ACT group show significantly great weight loss compare SR WLO group .
DOC.brief_title: Using Novel Behavioral Approaches Improve Long-Term Weight Loss Outcomes
DOC.criteria: BMI 27.540 Age 3065 currently participate weight loss program pregnant plan become pregnant medical condition would preclude physical activity terminal illness plan relocate history substance abuse psychological problem judge investigator likely interfere study participation
